If Obama had governed with the "transparency" he promised during his campaign, then the “wave of committee investigations” would be an innocuous non-issue. Instead he has governed with the paranoid secrecy of Nixon and now needs to be held accountable.

One thing you had absolutely right, though, " Mr. Obama’s election would have enraged those people even if he were white. ". Speaking as "one of those people", It isn't about race, it is all about policy. The policy of liberals, like Obama , is to expand the size scope, intrusiveness, and power of government. That should enrage any freedom-loving American. If Obama decided tomorrow to convert to a Libertarian orthodoxy, I would not only change my opinion of him, I would campaign for him. It is all about the policy.

..."If I were President Obama, I’d be doing all I could to head off this prospect, offering some major new initiatives on the economic front in particular, if only to shake up the political dynamic. But my guess is that the president will continue to play it safe, all the way into catastrophe."

So many of us are worried that President Obama will not step up to the plate, Professor Krugman. But....he either will or he won't. We are powerless to change him. What we can do is work on the media to speak truth about what is going on in American politics--as you have done in this op ed! Our media need to come out of their "fair and balanced" mode and move into "Cassandra country!" NOW!

I did not say, you will note, that we should support Obama! I think he is going to have to take the consequences of his mediating, bi-partisan strategy. And his thoughtful, professorial temperament, which I actually admire--but can see is not right for the job he so desperately needs to do differently.

No matter how angry any and/or all of you are at the wussy, spineless Democrats, I cannot believe there is anyone who wishes to have the crazy right-wing Republicans and Tea Partiers running our country. What Professor Krugman suggests they might do, is undoubtedly what they WILL do. We Progressives will have more of a voice if Democrats can stay in the majority. So, I'm going to BEG! Please support and vote for the Democrats in November. We can't afford not to.

As I predicted, not particularly presciently, because anyone paying attention to the news could have figured it out, the President is nowhere on this. When NBC News' Brian Williams asked President Obama Sunday about the 20% of folks who thought he was a foreign-born Muslim, the President swatted off the questions as old news:

"The facts are the facts. We went through some of this during the campaign. There is a mechanism, a network of misinformation, that in a new media era can get churned out there constantly. We dealt with this when I was first running for the U.S. Senate. WE dealt with it when we were first running for the presidency. There were those who said I couldn't win as U.S. Senator because I had a funny name & people would be too unfamiliar with it, and yet we ended up winning that Senate seat in Illinois because I trusted in the American people's capacity to get beyond all this nonsense & focus on, 'is this somebody who cares about me & cares about my family & has a vision for the future?' So I will always put my money on the American people, & I'm not going to be worrying too much about whatever rumors are floating out there. If I started spending all my time chasing after that, then I wouldn't get much done....

comments.commentBody:
So right you are on the orchestration of angers now going on.

When Frank Rich added his voice to Jane Mayer’s on the Koch brothers, and on Murdoch and others of the rich and powerful, many commenting here professed shock. How could such billionaires yet covet such power and riches at such great cost to humanity?

Let’s get one thing straight: we can’t ask human questions of the non-human. This includes the Koch brothers, Murdoch, and those you mention like them (such as Mellon in his hatred of Clinton). These who so desire power and riches may seem human – Herodotus, the world’s first historian, saw this, and all founders of great religions have, too – but the very nature of wealth and power promise freedom from humanity, elevation over it, and ability to buy it, turn it into the measurable, countable, controllable. Those signed on to this promise have gone some distance from their own and everybody else’s humanity.

Who spins this promise? If we don’t answer this, we surrender to inhuman inevitability. Thus Frank Rich and Jane Mayer cite laws of the U.S. which hurt the many for the sake of the few. But does something beyond the legalities of lobbyists, bribes, and biz also buoy the less-than-human?

We can answer this if we look further, at the institutions that teach the devices of the impersonal and the compartmented. American schools do this. Standardized testing does, and corporate textbooks, and nice, genteel professors in thrall to smooth-running machinery, aversion to the messily human.

Yes, the Kochs, Murdoch, and theirs are strangling the republic, spreading fear, hatreds, and wars. But they and theirs are going to dominate so long as schools at too many levels join them in cloning the same corporate habits.

The most infuriating part of the Obama administration is how uninspiring it is lately. He has done a lot in 1.5 years, but not enough. Lately, it seems to be coasting into oblivion as if it were faced by an inevitable irrelevance. The most insane parts of the opposition are on the verge of taking control, and none of the Democrats, and especially not the White House, appear to be doing anything of consequence. I know it is summer, but that is no excuse. Something had better change soon.

Whatever is going to happen, Paul, has already been set in place by the current group of Democrats.  There is nothing that one, or both houses of Congress can do -- with a Democratic President -- to undo all of the damage caused by this Democratic Congress.  Hopefully though, the new Republican majority will be able to prevent even more destructive governmental interference into the economy.

Limbaugh is P.T. Barnum, Jimmy Swaggart, Jim Baker of PTL fame all rolled into one. As you correctly state, Limbaugh is out to make a money and he says whatever he needs to say to play to the angry, racist crowds of sheeple.

Limbaugh claims to be a conservative "Christian" and yet he is a serial divorced man and has openly lived a life of libertinism and drug use.

Limbaugh is a Fraud with a capital "F". He says whatever it takes to make another hundred million dollars.

Great Piece Mr. Krugman!

The best hope for the economy is a Republican congress.  When the Democrats took over in 2007, the economy began to go downhill.  Even Paul Krugman concedes in his column that the 1990s were a time of prosperity.  Krugman should vote Republican.

We heartily agree with every single point you make Professor, especially the danger, which will be legislative and otherwise.

The one additional point might be that Rushbo is the leader of the Regressives/GOBP, since no one will speak up or out against what he says.

As we go into what may be the most important election of my life, I am reminded of an old quote which is appropos (in spades) to the GOP cabal sitting on the econmic side-lines with multi-trillion dollars in idle cash, trying to keep the economy so ailing that they will prevail at mid-terms:

"Everything they say and do is a lie - including the words 'and' and 'the'."

We will prevail if we stay motivated and work intelligently.

Rush Limbaugh is an embarassment to the Republican Party.

Limbaugh should be covered in Tar and Feathers and ridden out of town on the rails.

Rush is wrong and millions of silly fools drive around each day listening to the lies, filth and garbage he spews out from his nasty, racist, nouveau rich and cigar filled mouth.

His mouth is "an open grave" to quote the Psalmist.

This has been the summer of hate and confusion? The republicans have no ideas, and must rely on hating on the little man! When we should be given him all the capital and investment that we can! Voodoo economics is a lost cause, for the majority of us! Stop voting against your best interest, America?
Mr. and Mrs. Obama, I love you both but please wake-up!

Dr. Krugman,

I love your columns, but why do they always seemed filled with doom?

Do you really believe that the Democrats will lose control of the House?

Do you believe because the President has, in his words, been busy governing the last 18 months, that he has forgotten how to campaign?

I have no delusions that the Democrats will sail through the election unscathed, but considering some of the true right-wing radicals that the Republican party has nominated, the November elections may not be the Democratic bloodbath conventional wisdom predicts.

And if by some chance the insanity of the right spread to the independents and the GOP does take control in the House, then fine. They won't be able get anything past the President's veto. As far as investigations... let them do it and let them pay the price in 2012.

The Republican Party and the previous administration are still held, by far more to blame for the current state of the economy then Democrats. I want to see people vote for the abolition of social security and Medicare.

The GOP has become the party of the white, rich, mostly southern senior citizen. They may win a battle here and there. But in the long run, they will lose the war.
When will the American average voter will, at last, realize who are the true enemies of this country?
couldn't be more clear about how this is going to play out. I fear for my country.

It is up to the press to get on this story and deal with it honestly.
Will the real journalists please stand up?

Read Frank Rich's column. If 1/10 of it is true, why aren't reporters on this story like flies on rice? Why oh why can't we have better press corps? Is there an honest journalist anywhere?

If I were President Obama, I’d be doing all I could to head off this prospect, offering some major new initiatives on the economic front in particular, if only to shake up the political dynamic. But my guess is that the president will continue to play it safe, all the way into catastrophe.
...........................
Good Mr. Krugman finally recognizes the situation and the reality of a Democratic President that simply turned his back on Democrats.

Hopefully the Democrats will nominate a new candidate for President in 2012 so there at least might be chance of dealing with the serious problems that this President simply ignored.

Obama's attempts at bi-partisanship have been his ultimate downfall. For example, the $300B of stimulus he conceded for corporate tax cuts would have really come in handy right about now, as the effects of the helpful portion of the stimulus come to an end this Fall, and we slide into the double-dip.

Republicans are the enemy of the middle class, and the enemy of a functioning government. (Don't get me wrong, they're nice people, and as Boehner and Quayle, Jr demonstrate, they sure-do-know-how-to-party-yee-haw!) But at no point should they be trusted with, or consulted on, serious matters.

All in all, Obama is completely blinded by his obsession with making Republicans like him. It's sad that he doesn't realize that embracing their hatred is the key to 2012 success. Palin/Beck 2012 could be avoided if he just developed a spine/guts, etc...

Perceptive as always.  I harking back to the Eisenhower era and the old Republican tax brackets.  At that time I think the Republicans understood the meaning of wolf bait and the honorable among them the need to pay for the sweat and blood of the poorer citizens many of whom died in WWII.  The children of these Republicans have lost their sense of duty to their county.

Why are liberals and progressives paralyzed, rather than galvanized, by the dreary and dismaying prospect of a country falling apart? What prevents us from finding our voice and our power? When we can see where the blocks are to our own ability to wake up and get moving, we may begin to make some headway.

It wasn't just "prominent figures on the right" who lied about the Clintons. There were many careerist mainstream media figures, some working for the New York Times, who were more than willing to carry water and defamatory tall tales for the Republicans. In fact, the New York Times virtually made up the Whitewater "scandal." Maybe this time around the mainstream media will be a little more circumspect if and when the Republicans start trying to impeach President Obama on some trumped up piece of nonsense. Meanwhile, our economy will continue to sink, jobs and manufacturing will continue moving out of our country and the destruction of the American working and middle classes will continue.

Why hasn't bipartisanship worked out?

A few years ago, there was a rising Republican star named Charlie Crist. He had just been elected governor of Florida, and was seriously discussed as a Vice Presidential pick for John McCain. A 2012 Presidential campaign seemed to be a real possibility.

Then Mr Crist decided to try bipartisanship.

As a result of that he faced a primary challenge from conservative Republican Marco Rubio. The primary challenge was sucessful, and Crist has been forced to run as a Joe Lieberman style independent.

Crist. Spectre. Scozzofava. Bennet. Chafee. McCain. All were deemed to be RINOs by the conservative right, and all faced serious and usually sucessful primary challenges.

That is why bipartisanship is dead. Then again, when a party controls both houses of Congress and the Presidency, they should have no trouble passing their program without bipartisanship. And they have to be willing to accept the responsibility that comes with that kind of power. The Democrats have done neither. Preserving the traditions of the Senate has been more important than passing their agenda. And the Democrat Party has been very reluctant to take full ownership of their policies.

I am sick and tired of the wealthy, the banks, and the big corporations.  Switch the currency or retire the dollar, give the middle class it's own type of money and just leave them all hanging out to dry.

"What we learned from the Clinton years is that a significant number of Americans just don’t consider government by liberals — even very moderate liberals — legitimate."

And most of these Americans don't even know why.

If Democrats lose a majority in either house or senate it will not be because of Rush Limbaugh or Glenn Beck. It will be because a majority of the voters, worried about losing their jobs and homes, feel that President Obama appears out of touch with their economic pain.

Laura Tyson had a good column today in the NY TImes in which she suggested a second stimulus package including more help for the states, more support for education, more infrastructure spending and high-speed electrified rail between states (which might partially address the coming age of oil shortages). Why isn't the president pushing such a program himself? Just exactly how is President Obama's nonexistent plan superior to Republican obstructionism?
